title: 113_hr3170
content: The "Health Care Regulator Accountability Act" mandates that health plans created under PPACA or offered through exchanges are the only plans the federal government can provide to federal employees responsible for administering PPACA. Section 1312(d)(3)(D) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to include certain federal employees in addition to Members of Congress and congressional staff. The amendment specifies that federal employees responsible for the administration of the Act are also included in the coverage. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act now includes federal employees responsible for its administration, in addition to Members of Congress and congressional staff. The term 'Federal employee responsible for the administration of this Act' refers to a federal employee in specific government agencies. The term 'Federal employee responsible for the administration of this Act' refers to a federal employee in specific government agencies, as defined by section 105 of title 5, United States Code, with specified duties and responsibilities. The term 'Federal employee responsible for the administration of this Act' refers to a federal employee in specific government agencies with duties related to promulgating rules, regulations, and enforcing the Act or its amendments. The term 'Federal employee responsible for the administration of this Act' refers to a federal employee in specific government agencies with duties related to enforcing the Act or its amendments. This involves the administration of the Act or its amendments. SEC. 3. ENFORCEMENT. The term 'Federal employee' includes individuals defined in section 2105 of title 5, United States Code, as determined by the head of the employing agency. The Secretary of Health and Human Services, the Director of the Internal Revenue Service, and other agency heads involved in enforcing the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act are limited to spending 90 percent of their funds for salaries and expenses unless regulations are promulgated before the end of the fiscal year. Any unspent amounts at the end of the fiscal year will be rescinded. Limitation: This section does not affect funds available for purposes other than salaries or administrative expenses of the office involved.
